name: Who broke the build
body: **Who broke the build** is an Alexa Skill that runs on [AWS Lambda](https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/). Use it to shame your co-workers when they break the Jenkins build. ### Requirements * Jenkins server * [Amazon Echo](http://www.amazon.com/Amazon-SK705DI-Echo/dp/B00X4WHP5E/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1449368230&sr=8-1&keywords=echo) * Aws account * Amazon Alexa Developer account ### How to use it The following steps assume you are already familiar with creating Alexa Skills and AWS Lambdas. * Create a new AWS Lambda function. * Download this project source code and run `npm install` on it. * Modify the **Gruntfile.js** to add your Lambda ARN. * Create a file **config.json** with the following content: ``` { "jenkinsUrl": "yourjenkins.com", "jenkinsPort": 8080, "jenkinsUser": "jenkins", "jenkinsApiToken": "replace_with_your_jenkins_api_token", "jenkinsJobName": "Name of the job you are interested in watching if breaks" } ``` * On your terminal, execute `grunt deploy` to upload your code to the Lambda function. * Create a new Alexa Skill and define the Invocation Name as **jenkins**. * Define the interaction model as follows: ``` { "intents": [ { "intent": "WhoBrokeTheBuild", "slots": [] } ] } ``` * Define the utterances. You can define many more if you like! ``` WhoBrokeTheBuild who broke the build ``` Once everything is configured, you can simply say to your Amazon Echo: *"Alexa, ask jenkins who broke the build"* ### Enjoy!
